intro: Dipelta wenxianensis, commonly known as the Wenxian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils and is found in specific regions of Henan Province. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
